title: Why a 17-Year-Old Built an AI Model to Expose Deepfake Maps
summary: Seventeen-year-old researcher Oliver Taylor developed an AI model to identify deepfake maps, which are manipulated geographic images that can spread misinformation, disrupt navigation systems, and even challenge territorial claims. Taylor's tool analyzes pixel patterns and inconsistencies that are indicative of digital tampering. His innovation demonstrates the growing concern over the misuse of deepfake technology beyond its traditional focus on images and videos, underscoring the importance of new methods to verify the authenticity of geospatial data to prevent potential geopolitical and societal issues.

title: Cellik Android malware builds malicious versions from Google Play apps
summary: The article discusses a new strain of Android malware called Cellik, which is capable of creating malicious versions of legitimate apps sourced from Google Play. This malware hijacks genuine apps and embeds harmful code, enabling it to perform unauthorized actions such as stealing personal information or accessing sensitive data without the user's knowledge. Cellik's ability to mimic legitimate applications makes it particularly dangerous, as users may unknowingly download and install these compromised versions, thinking they are getting a safe app from a trusted source like Google Play. title: Amazon disrupts Russian GRU hackers attacking edge network devices
summary: Amazon has successfully disrupted a significant cyber operation conducted by hackers linked to Russia's GRU, the country's military intelligence agency. These hackers targeted edge network devices, attempting to exploit vulnerabilities to execute cyber espionage and data theft. The operation reflected a broader pattern of increasing cyberattacks by state-sponsored groups on critical network infrastructure. Amazon's intervention included working with various partners to identify, block, and mitigate these threats, thereby enhancing security measures for affected network devices.
